website_summaries.verdict: A popular diaper by a trusted name in the industry. Tops our list for performance, comfort, and reputation.
pros: Offers exceptional wetness protection for up to 12 hours with channels and Absorb Away liner
This brand is the number-one selling newborn diapers in hospitals
cons: Some consumers noticed that the diapers carry a scent, and noted that some parents prefer unscented diapers for newborns

customer_reviews.title: I do not think these are real Pampers
customer_reviews.text: I do not think that these diapers are the same as the store bought brand. I will not purchase these again. I had a pack I received from the hospital and opened my new box and compared the diapers side by side. These diapers are more rough, they also spell like a plastic chemical smell. I will not order these again and feel like these are a "knock off". If you are pressed for cash, and need a cheap alternative, then these will fit the bill. But I am worried as to what could possibly be in these diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Fitting, Softest Diapers
customer_reviews.text: Pampers Swaddlers are the only diapers I will use for my baby! I love how soft they are, and that they provide great protection against leaks. They fit perfectly and don't hang down when wet or full - I really don't like diapers that do that and I've never had that problem with the Swaddlers. I like the wetness indicator because sometimes you just can't tell! For this purchase I received a gift card from Pampers - but I have tried other brands like Huggies, Honest, Seventh Generation and Luvs, but none of them are as good and I always regret when I try something else, and always come back to Pampers. I highly recommend these diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Blair B

customer_reviews.title: Tried other big name brands but this was best for leakage on my newborns.
customer_reviews.text: I always buy these brand/type diapers for my newborns. They fit my kids great and have enough adjustability if the diapers are too big, a couple weeks after being born. These provide the best seal to reduce the amount of leakage for my average sized asian kids. Tried other big name brands but this was best for leakage on my babies. Just have to check and readjust seals by running your fingers and tugging the diapers edge at the seal between the diapers and the legs. When my kids outgrow these, I switch to cheaper brands which provide the same leakage protection as long as the seals are properly verified.
customer_reviews.author: Moon Knight 808

customer_reviews.title: Give other diapers a shot.
customer_reviews.text: I used these exclusively for my first son and was always very happy with them. I even tried all the other brands just to be sure they were best and I felt that they were. This time around, I don't feel the same. perhaps something changed in the last few years?? There is a very strong chemical smell to them that I don't remember being there before. Especially compared to others. They're not as soft and for my belly sleeper they just don't hold up sadly. I gave the Up and Up ones a shot and found that they smell better, are cheaper, softer and hold up for 6 hours of belly sleeping so for now I'll be using those.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni BTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: same as used at the hospital
customer_reviews.text: They used these at the hospital and I continued to use them at home out of convenience. They have a wet indicator and cute print. Did not notice much of a difference between these and huggies. Definitely worth spending a little more on one of the two for newborns. Even though you are constantly changing their diapers, middle of the night blow outs from cheap diapers are not worth it and having good quality diapers on their baby skin is important. **Please help and select if this review was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany JohnsonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: We used these for a week and my youngest had the worst diaper rash I've seen
customer_reviews.text: I think something changed in pampers between my first and second. We used these for a week and my youngest had the worst diaper rash I've seen. Ended up switching to another brand because no matter how quickly I changed her diapers, the rash was just getting worse.
customer_reviews.author: nike13Top Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would like these, before I knew any better
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would like these, before I knew any better. I registered for these based on the commercials and got a few boxes before my daughter was born. We used Huggies in the hospital, then when we brought her home we opened our Pampers box. Huge difference. Pampers were not as soft or flexible. The Huggies were a game changer for me and I won't look back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers on the market!
customer_reviews.text: When my son was first born, he had to stay in the NICU for a week. The hospital he was born in provided the pampers swaddles and they were the softest, yet most durable diapers I could use for him. At my baby shower I was provided with many different brands and had no idea what the standard for good diapers were, I tried a few different kinds out and none of them quiet measured up to the quality of the pampers swaddles. They can be a little pricier, but like most other products, you get what you pay for! Definitely worth the purchase for your infant to be as comfortable as you can possibly make them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for Smaller Newborns (6lbs)
customer_reviews.text: These Newborn Pampers fit our newborn much better than the Newborn Huggies (too big.) Our newborn was born weighing 6lbs 13.3oz, with a tiny waist, and these particular diapers are the same ones that the hospital supplied to us, so we bought these for home and they're perfect. We love the double layer of protection. These diapers are shaped to go around the belly button so it's not rubbed or irritated by the diaper. They also have a yellow Line that turns blue when the diaper is wet. It makes it easy to know when the diaper needs to be changed. We'll definitely be ordering these for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: The price is very tempting, but don't be fooled. These are a much different product than the Pampers Swaddlers you buy from the brick and mortar stores. The biggest difference is the chemical smell of these diapers. They also seemed to be not as thick...the poo seeped through! Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaLinds

customer_reviews.title: mixed feelings about pampers
customer_reviews.text: Pro: that awesome yellow/blue line that tells you when they are wet. Especially with a newborn it can be hard to tell without opening a diaper. Con; If your baby is at all sensitive, these may not be ideal. If you do decide to go with pampers be sure to join Amazon Mom/subscribe & Save or whatever they call it. 20% off! I still use the pampers overnight diapers, but have switched to the more expensive Honest Company brand to avoid diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: Gailism

customer_reviews.title: Love pampers swaddlers
customer_reviews.text: Love pampers swaddlers, have been using it with my 2 year old from size 1 to 6 and it is the best! No leaks, and so gentle on his sensitive skin. The newborn size however, contains newborn poop nicely without accidents but the pee did leak. Don't know though if that is because his cord hasn't dried off and thus the daiper is loose. Will update again once the cord falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Noha

customer_reviews.title: Holds it in. Thats all that matters!
customer_reviews.text: My baby boy pees every 2 hours and soils them every 4 hours. There has not been an incident where the diaper failed. Very absorbent and sturdy. I have heard some say, the baby skin becomes allergic to certain brand of diapers but it was not the case with us. Would highly recommend for babies upto ~12.5 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Balaji

customer_reviews.title: twin mom approved!
customer_reviews.text: Pampers Swaddlers are expensive, but so worth it for the first month or so of your baby's life. They are soft, almost fabric-like, and have a blue stripe wetness indicator, which I liked having. Once my babies got older, I switched them to brands that were a it cheaper without any issues, but on those tiny newborn bums, I absolutely recommend these diapers. - mom of twins
customer_reviews.author: brooke

customer_reviews.title: Decent diapers high cost
customer_reviews.text: Good diapers high price though especially for newborns size when baby is growing so fast. I got halfway through my sexind box and had to move up a size now have a bunch of diapers we can't use. Cute designs and came recommended by other mom's. No visual issues except they can get tight around the thighs.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: ... Pampers Newborn Diapers when in the hospital and were happy to see they fit our little one great
customer_reviews.text: We were given Pampers Newborn Diapers when in the hospital and were happy to see they fit our little one great. When we went home we continued using ones that we were given at my shower. They fit fantastic and are super absorbent. I have not had any blowouts or leaks while my baby has used this diapers. We were also given a box of Huggies and the Pampers fit WAY better than those. I also love the yellow line that turns blue when the diaper is wet. Makes checking if the baby needs a change, a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: LizzyBee

customer_reviews.title: The best! We loved them with our first and love ...
customer_reviews.text: The best! We loved them with our first and love them with our 2nd. They provide her the coverage needed to keep her and her outfits dry. We've had no accidents of blowouts with our daughter this go around. We had very minimal with our first, where with Huggies, it was an issue every diaper. And the diaper is gentle on my girls skin. My oldest has sensitive skin, and these have never broke her out.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi

customer_reviews.title: Going to keep purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Love these much more than huggies. We tried new born huggies on my son and he kept peeing out of them onto his outfits. With these diapers we’ve had way less accidents as we wait for the umbilical cord stump to fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Weird Mesh Lining
customer_reviews.text: I don't get why Pampers are so popular. They're fine. They're just as expensive as Huggies though, and Huggies are nicer. I'm giving these a sub-par rating mostly because the newborn Swaddlers have a weird mesh-like lining in them that stick to my baby. I don't understand it. I guess maybe we're just Huggies people. :-/
customer_reviews.author: Beard///

customer_reviews.title: Red marks
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. I like the strip but they do leave marks on my babies legs. I don't know if they are too tight or it's just the ribbing on the legs but it doesn't look too comfortable. They hold in any waste but the red marks are disconcerting.
customer_reviews.author: ditto

customer_reviews.title: Great fit - but moved to size 1 before I used them all!
customer_reviews.text: I love the pampers swaddlers - they tell me if my kid has peed in the diaper, and seem to fit well. With a newborn I always buy the big box! Turns out I bought more than I needed, as we soon moved to size 1.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Newborn baby pleased with Pampers
customer_reviews.text: Pampers is the first brand I tried with my newborn baby and it's working very well for him. He seems to have sensitive skin and hasn't had any reaction to these diapers. I also love that the newborn size fits up to 10lbs instead of the typical 8 or 9lbs in other brands. Price is compatible to what you'd pay at Walmart too.
customer_reviews.author: Brocko

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, small fit.
customer_reviews.text: Pampers diapers were the kind that the hospital used when we there after giving birth to my daughter. We decided to get that brand, since that's what we'd been using while away. After using them for a little while, I started to realize little things that I preferred of other brands. Pampers, while soft and delicate against my daughters skin, fit awfully small compare to the huggies brand I had purchased with my son. Quality wise, Pampers are great, I just wish they fit my daughter longer.
customer_reviews.author: Melonie

customer_reviews.title: Great for newborn
customer_reviews.text: These are the diapers we used in the hospital and they worked great for us at home, too. We will likely continue with pampers as they are one of the most effective brands we've used - and we've tried a lot!
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite brand
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Conforms well 2. The leg seams seals in poop - no spills! 3. Soft, the mesh looking lining keeps the wet diaper part away from the baby's skin Cons: 1. It doesn't put itself on the baby Summary: We've used Pampers for both kids and like the way it fits our babies. The leg seams has a great seal, have never had poo leak out a leg seam. (Of course, nothing can contain the diaper back blowout). Very happy with it, no real negatives. If one day someone invents a diaper that puts itself on the baby, I'll be willing to pay a premium for those diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel's Dad

customer_reviews.title: These soak up moisture much better than Huggies and the color strip isn't as sensitive ...
customer_reviews.text: Update*Pampers has changed their product. As tou can see from precious review with my first son, I was happy. These diapers are now terrible and I have switched to huggies. They leak and fall apart. No joke, I have had at least three leaky diapers a day on my youngest son. I do not recommend anyone waste their money on these! *These soak up moisture much better than Huggies and the color strip isn't as sensitive so you don't waste a diaper for a tiny tinkle that you wouldn't have ever known was there.
customer_reviews.author: d4&co

customer_reviews.title: Lame.  Strong scent, thinner than in-store version...
customer_reviews.text: These are drastically different than what we bought in stores. Thinner, and have a strong scent (seems like it's trying to be baby powder scent, but my wife hates it). Might work for some people, and definitely cost effective, but the fit, scent (and doubt cast on where these came from for my wife) ended up being a show stopper for us. Too bad, we were excited to use amazon subscriptions for this but it's already turned into more trouble than it was worth. Some of the pictures others have posted look like the difference between what we had in hand before this and what we got by ordering this item.
customer_reviews.author: AKhistorystudent

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent, extra protection around the legs
customer_reviews.text: These were the diapers used in the NICU when my son was born and stayed 25days there. They have an extra innner ruffle around the leg to keep stuff in and not all over his legs and they are very absorbent as well. We tried using huggies diapers but we had leaks every single time we changed him. Honestly the only thing i dislike is that some of them have Elmo on them and i absolutely cannot stand that creepy little character. Everything else is great about them
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable diaper
customer_reviews.text: My baby boy which is now 3 weeks old has done very well with these diapers. We have not tried any other brands/styles/sizes yet. The blue indicator strip is accurate; and the length of the indicator changing to blue is quite helpful in knowing the magnitude in which our boy has urinated. The fastening tabs always stay put and we haven't had any diapers that fell apart yet. Up to this point; our boy hasn't wet/dirted his clothes; so the diaper does a great job containing his pee and bowel movements.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the horror at bay
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money. Sturdy construction. Our #1 choice for safe containment of an unending supply of baby feces variations.
customer_reviews.author: MRH

customer_reviews.title: They actually absorb so when you open the diaper it isn't a puddle and doesn't run all over like other brands and they fit high up to help ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd never use any other diaper for my kids!!! I have 4-5 boxes of diapers of other brands people have given me that I tried but still have them all in my closet because none come even close to papmers. They actually absorb so when you open the diaper it isn't a puddle and doesn't run all over like other brands and they fit high up to help keep the mess in
customer_reviews.author: alottagnaw

customer_reviews.title: Hosptal Approved
customer_reviews.text: My Niece loved these. I sent them to her for her shower and she said they are highly recommended by her doctor and the hospital where she is going to give birth. Pampers is a well respected name so I suspect the product will live up to its name.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sloane

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best diapers we have found! We did cloth diapers for a while but when we switched to regular diapers, my daughter responded best to these. I love that it has the wetness indicator, it helped when she was very young. They fit well and anytime we switched to another diaper brand she would break out in a rash. We have stuck with the swaddlers and they are the only ones we will use!
customer_reviews.author: Sf87

customer_reviews.title: these worked the best for our kiddo
customer_reviews.text: We received multiple kinds of diapers at our baby shower for our first child. Of the multiple kinds of diapers we tried, these worked the best for our kiddo, seemed to have fewer leaks, didn't bother her skin and we had zero problems with diaper rash (opposed to one kind we tried that we almost immediately had problems with)
customer_reviews.author: Tinycat

customer_reviews.title: Love the style
customer_reviews.text: We prefer pampers swaddlers over Huggies & Honest Co. They have the blue line indicator (Honest Co does not) and the waist band is easy to lay flat for fast changing (Huggies are too tight to unfold quickly without them scrunching back up mid-charge).
customer_reviews.author: Kate Vanderwoude

customer_reviews.title: very absorbent, moisture wicking
customer_reviews.text: They hold a lot of moisture and wick it away from the skin, so she doesn't have to be changed every single time she pees, and when she poos it doesn't leak if properly put on.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: get pampers sensitive instead
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered these they were great. They were packaged correctly with the right amount in the box. When I ordered more of them they were individual 20 packs shoved in an unmarked box and there were only 120 diapers instead of 128. The diapers in theses individual 20 packs were definitely of a lesser quality than the diapers I had received previously. I now order the pampers sensitive instead.
customer_reviews.author: stef

customer_reviews.title: One of the best diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have stuck to pampers swaddlers since my oldest tried all of the diapers and these were seriously the best. I’m now on my third child and will continue to use these over most other brands because they are soft and provide protection against leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers
customer_reviews.text: The best diapers for new parents. They have a yellow line that turns blue when soiled. Helps new parents learn when to change the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers. Wish we could find something as easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great diapers. Wish we could find something as easy with less of a carbon footprint. Hospital recommended. Our guy is little and still wears size N at three months.
customer_reviews.author: CuriousAmy

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a new grand baby
customer_reviews.text: Pamper delivery arrived on time. I love the fact that I received an email letting me know how many days I had to make any changes to the next delivery before It went out and I was charged. This is a great baby gift for a grandparent to give ... 3 to a year supply of pampers.
customer_reviews.author: W.D.P.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Diapers
customer_reviews.text: Only had one blowout with this entire box of diapers. These fit my newborn wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: james jones

customer_reviews.title: Great prices. Made a diaper cake for my husband's ...
customer_reviews.text: Great prices. Made a diaper cake for my husband's niece. I normally make the diaper cakes with Wal-Mart's diapers but couldn't find the "Cloud" diapers any more. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: Pampers swaddles are simply the best. I have tried many brands and none compare
customer_reviews.text: Pampers swaddles are simply the best. I have tried many brands and none compare! The material is so soft for a baby and holds big explosive messes!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic diapers
customer_reviews.text: Pampers is a great brand the diapers are great! They are pricier than some other brands but when buying cheap brands your babies tooshy may have to pay the real price of horrible diaper rash. Worth the money for these!
customer_reviews.author: MUR

customer_reviews.title: BUDGETING
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i expected & i feel relieved of a lot of stress Amazon is amazing & helpful in preparation for my baby to enter this world, you may think this is pricy but it's actually saves money for instance the dollar store's sell them $10.65-32Ct... So three pack's at 10.65 & your up to $31.95 only purchasing 96 diapers VS 128ct for $35... Of course order in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: #1 diaper for newborns! These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Used these with my first and now bought them for my twins! These are amazing! And I love that they have a line to show you if the baby wet the diapers and if they are full the line is completely blue! Definitely my #1 diaper to go to with newborns!
customer_reviews.author: Lenka

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: I loved pampers brand from the very start. I tried moving to huggies because of the cost but end up going back to pampers. Their leak protection is so much better. As a parent, you don’t do want your diapers to leak. It’s just a mess that gets everywhere and sometimes ruin clothes. Stick with pampers. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Lam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 4 different brands of diapers and Pampers Swaddlers are the only ones that I like. They hug around the legs to prevent leaks and have a strip that lets you know when they are wet. I also found that they are cheapest here instead of in store.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Rinner

customer_reviews.title: I like the way they smell
customer_reviews.text: These are smaller than the huggies size 1. I like the way they smell. They keep baby dry all night. I tend to use the pampers next size first and then move to huggies toward the transition to the next size.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my daughters first baby. Waited 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughters first baby. Waited 5 days with my prime and she just text me and theirs 2 different size diapers and theirs Huggies in the box also. WTF?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift for a newborn!
customer_reviews.text: My niece said that both she and her new daughter were thrilled with them! They have come in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Karvin Spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: Indicator strip
customer_reviews.text: We love using pamper swaddlers at the newborn stage for the indicator strip that turns from yellow to green when wet. We've had a few links but only because we needed to go up a size in diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Danna Nims

customer_reviews.title: These are not what they seem.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the same Papmers Swaddlers you will get at any other retailer. Advertised as Pampers Swaddlers but they're not. Pampers is selling Amazon a different quality diaper than what they are selling everyone else. The only thing that's the same is the box. If you think you're getting a good price on Pampers I'm sad to say you aren't, but if you love blow out diapers every day then these are for you. I have to go get my Pampers diapers from Target every time now. I don't blame Amazon. I blame Pampers for thinking we wouldn't notice.
customer_reviews.author: Will Straughn

customer_reviews.title: Love. Love. Love.
customer_reviews.text: Pampers diapers are always my favorite. I oove the wet indicater and i love how they fit. This is the only diaper we didnt experience leaks with, it forms so well to a newborns body. They fabric is soft as not to irritate the new babies bottom. Overall a great product. The rewards codes are such a perk.
customer_reviews.author: KatrinaL.

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: New mom so new to diapers. The quality is great and holds a lot without leaking. I did find that Wal-Mart has a bigger package for about the same price but after trying these, huggies, costco brand, and Luvs so far these are my favorite diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers. 1000x better then Huggies or any of the other brands. Every time I try other diapers we end up with leaks or blowouts, never has happened with pampers.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Love these diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Pampers Swaddlers are the best diapers ever! Worth the extra money because they have a nice netting in them that keeps the poop away from the tush!
customer_reviews.author: Cory H.

customer_reviews.title: If your baby is still in blowout stage. Don’t buy pampers.
customer_reviews.text: Huggies are better for blowouts! Great diapers only if past blowout stage.
customer_reviews.author: SFNKprime

customer_reviews.title: From the moment my baby was taken out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: From the moment my baby was taken out of the hospital we used the Pampers Swaddlers. We never had any problems. As he has gotten older, we continue to use these. He did outgrow the Newborn size fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: tried one time to switch brand but made a terrible mistake and caused rash on my baby girl
customer_reviews.text: i have using this brand ever since my baby was born. tried one time to switch brand but made a terrible mistake and caused rash on my baby girl.
customer_reviews.author: Hollandking

customer_reviews.title: Great for Infants Under 7lbs
customer_reviews.text: We want to use organic diapers but when your baby is under 7lbs they just don't fit (tried 4 different brands). Pampers NB are the only diapers that actually fit him at the moment and the "pee line" is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Everett

customer_reviews.title: Not a deep umbilical cut out!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these newborn swaddlers with the impression that the umbilical cord cut out was deep. You can barely tell there is a cut out. I compared these diapers to the newborn Huggies brand with the umbilical cut out and the Huggies is the winner. Since I don't think I can return these diapers, I will just have to fold them below babies umbilical. Waste! Which isn't a big deal, but was looking for peace of mind. This is why I hate buying items like this on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: The only diaper we use on our baby!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried other brands and have always found our way back to pampers. This is a seemingly superior product to the competition. Other brands we tried had issues with fitment and leaking while we have never had any problems with the pampers. The wetness indicator line on the pampers is also quite visible and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua brown

customer_reviews.title: I love Pampers diapers
customer_reviews.text: I love Pampers and they are the only diapers I use and have used for All 4 of my kids. They are pretty much impossible to have leaks in these diapers unless you leave a diaper on for like 16 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R

customer_reviews.title: Buy from Amazon and Save... Time and Money!
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price of these diapers ordering online. In your local store, they are typically $40 for the 72 pack! Save yourself significant money and a trip to a store and set these up for recurring order on Amazon. As a diaper, they function as expected. No major blowouts and a tight, comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Taj

customer_reviews.title: I think diapers are a personal preference and depend on ...
customer_reviews.text: I think diapers are a personal preference and depend on the baby. I find pampers to be thinner and less absorbing than their competitors
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Devji

customer_reviews.title: Always Pampers
customer_reviews.text: these have always worked great for my kids. One of many good things is the poop does not make its way out through the back like huggies does. The disposable Pampers will always be my #1 choice unless I find better.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia B.

customer_reviews.title: Pampers has a reputation of being the best, blow out free
customer_reviews.text: Shipped very fast and damaged free. Pampers has a reputation of being the best, blow out free, baby diaper on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are horrible. Every time our baby pees, the diaper leaks. We thought it was the way we were putting on the diaper but no. We tried different methods and each time the diaper leaked. It is annoying finding you baby soaked in pee and having to constantly wash the matters/pad covers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: used for a month before baby outgrew them
customer_reviews.text: happy we got them on Amazon Mom since the prices cant be beat! Some blow ups but nothing too terrible. Baby doesnt get rashes and no skin irritation so we're happy with these diapers. Chose pampers because that's what the hospital gave us and since they work and don't cause skin irritation for the baby, we're sticking with them. Used these for a month before moving to size 1.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Smell AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: A diaper that starts off smelling like this gives hope of a similar result after it's use! Must have!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Van Peenen

customer_reviews.title: Probably great.
customer_reviews.text: Probably are great. Never had to use this size. Bought before baby was born. Baby was too big for them. They are for babies under 10lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur T. Cantwell

customer_reviews.title: A must have for newborns!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend pampers newborn diapers! Our baby is up every 3-4 hours and has never leaked through these. Perfect for new moms & dads because of the line down the middle that turns blue when wet/dirty. The fit is perfect for newborns! My now toddler wore newborn until 10lbs and my 4lbs preemie fits in newborn (top folded a couple times). Great product for all babies!
customer_reviews.author: Jill M Krutka

customer_reviews.title: These are soft and great for newborns
customer_reviews.text: These are soft and great for newborns, and did not have many leaks or blow outs. I used two boxes of these in baby’s first month, and when she got bigger I switched to Luvs, which are much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: MellowYellow TTT

customer_reviews.title: Effective for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these exclusively on our newborn for the past two months. My wife and I have very sensitive skin, and these have caused no negative reaction for us or the baby. Importantly, they are effective at cleaning; only with the dirtiest diapers to we have to use multiple wipes. By simply following these wipes with a tissue to get any small amount of lingering moisture, we have kept a clean, dry, happy babe, with no incidences of diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper
customer_reviews.text: Love Pampers Swaddlers, they fit great. They run a little roomy compared to the baby dry. They do have the line that goes from yellow to green, to indicate when baby is wet/dirty. They work well for my baby that has sensitive skin. The box arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: kiman825

customer_reviews.title: No alergic reactions, the line tells it all.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the fact that Pampers Swaddlers for newborns. Did not break my Grandson out. I also really liked the line on the diaper. It told us if he was wet or not. I can't think of one thing that was bad about the Swaddlers. I would recommend them for all new parents.
customer_reviews.author: Davina Sheward

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect price and size for my new, tiny grandbaby. Love Pampers brand.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pampers are by far the #1 diaper that we have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Favorite for newborns
customer_reviews.text: Pampers Swaddlers really are my favorite diaper, especially for newborns. They are soft and they hold a lot of urine. They fit really well. I have tried Huggies in different varieties and they always leak. I do like Honest diapers, but these are still my favorite for newborns. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth W

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used Swaddlers on our other grandchild and they fit so well. Seller ships fast!! Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: timely and vital
customer_reviews.text: arrived in time to greatly help new parents with their early born
customer_reviews.author: William H. Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! My son has super sensitive skin and these are the top of the line! Never had a leak or a blow out!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Just the best disposables.
customer_reviews.text: Swaddlers are the best. They hold all the gross and wet stuff in. I could do without the lisenced tv characters but what can you do it's all over all the baby stuff whether I like it or not. I used these, cloth diapers, and then we used some store brand... Cloth is great but sometimes you want disposables and the store brand just cannot compare. Love the blue stripe too.
customer_reviews.author: KandR

customer_reviews.title: wetness indicator is key
customer_reviews.text: Love these. The indicator is key at this age because they pee such small amounts it's hard to tell when they're wet. The size is so great for the first few days. Make sure you have size 1 in the house though, because they grow out of these so fast!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Balsam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the pampers swaddlers! absorbant, comfy, have never seen rashes or irritation, great job pampers!
customer_reviews.author: cody reurink

customer_reviews.title: These diapers are great! I tried multiple brands
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are great! I tried multiple brands, and these are the only ones that my baby doesn't leak through! Side note, they smell amazing too :D
customer_reviews.author: Usama Quraishi

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, no rashes and absorbant
customer_reviews.text: We used these diapers from day 1 when our baby was just 5 lbs 15 oz. We never had any leaks, spills or rashes and our baby was always content with the absorption. As a result we've continued to grow with Pampers Swaddlers through various sizes. (We also tried the Sensitive Pampers Swaddlers. Our baby didn't seem to notice a difference between the two.)
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Save your money... BUY Huggies instead!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design. The outer layer mess absorbent separates and sticks to my child's bottom and I'm not allowing a lot of time in between changings. Huggies are designed much better where this won't happen. I will send back and never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best diapers I've used. Love the blue indication line that appears to tell me when baby has peed or pooped.
customer_reviews.author: mer

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: This product is defective. About half of the straps from the side come off very easily before I can stick the diaper on. I’m not sure if I just received a bad box but it’s a waste of money when all the sides keep coming off. The ones that do stick on are fine.
customer_reviews.author: sharbajan

customer_reviews.title: The thin blue line
customer_reviews.text: Great diapers for newborn. They are soft, easy to put on, and we havent had a blowout yet. They have a blue line that appears on the diaper to indicate whether it is wet. This takes the guesswork or the close encounters with my nose.
customer_reviews.author: crash2311

customer_reviews.title: Good Product but you may find it cheaper at different shop
customer_reviews.text: Good Product but you may find it cheaper at different shop
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers hands down
customer_reviews.text: The best diapers hands down! No leaks, rips, or irritation. They feel soft, do the job, and fit so great with the elastic sides.
customer_reviews.author: sanddollar8

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It came super fast and much needed as this baby is on the way!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My least favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: I perfer huggies. Everyone told me to use pampers but he had major blowouts all the time. Since switching to huggies I have not had that problem. They work better that store brand diapers but are no better than luvs.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Big fan!
customer_reviews.text: We decided to try these and the Huggies Snugglers, we like these better. They seem a little roomier and cover him well. We had a few leakage problems with the Huggies that we did not experience with these. The tabs can be a bit stubborn at times but that is my biggest complaint. We are moving into Size one and are going to stay with the Pampers.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMRB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best pampers/diapers hands down!!! just wish they weren't so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s like these aren’t really pampers or are defective
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are way bigger than the other newborns we have. I’ve been buying these exact same diapers from the same seller since my babies were born. It’s like these aren’t really pampers or are defective. I held them up next to ones from my previous box and order and they are WAY bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Pampers Swadlers Size N
product_meta.description:
Size:Size NewbornPampers swaddles size N

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Recommended Weight: upto 10 Pounds. Pampers Swadlers size N
Wetness Indicator lets you know when your baby might need a change
Soft,Stretchy Sides Helps the diaper stay in place,flexing with baby's every move
Air Dry channels Breathable dryness to keep your baby comfortable
Absorb Away Liner pulls wetness and mess away from baby's skin to help keep your baby comfortable
